name: Deploy your own on-chain zkml models with ezkl
description:
Running ai/ml models in a zero-knowledge proof makes it as though they run on chain. This lets the chain perceive the world and gives smart contracts the ability to exercise judgement. Learn how to take your own ML models and turn them into provers and on-chain verifiers using our open-source tool ezkl (https://github.com/zkonduit/ezkl). Beginner-friendly, but we will also delve into some technical and mathematical details for the interested.

Target audience: People who are new to ZK but who have a technical background, or are experienced with ZK and are curious about the technical details of how ezkl works.
Beginner-friendly, but we will also delve into some technical and mathematical details for the interested. 






 






People who are new to ZK but who have a technical background, or are experienced with ZK and are curious about the technical details of how ezkl works.
gpt_description: of like a pipeline for running machine learning models on the blockchain using zero-knowledge proofs. The goal is to make it possible for smart contracts to exercise judgments and recognize individuals, among other applications. Currently, off-chain ML AI models are centralized and require trust in the person running the model, while smart contracts are decentralized but too slow and not scalable for running large ML models. The solution is to use ZK techniques to preserve trustlessness, decentralization, and scalability. The tool is being built to make it easy to run familiar Python tooling and access existing ML models, making it possible to transition from off-chain to on-chain organizations. The video includes a demonstration of a Python model being exported and turned into a specific circuit that can be run on the blockchain.
